utility.hpp

00001 #ifndef  BOOST_SERIALIZATION_UTILITY_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_UTILITY_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // serialization/utility.hpp:
00011 // serialization for stl utility templates

00020 #include <utility>
00021 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00022 
00023 #include <boost/type_traits/remove_const.hpp>
00024 #include <boost/serialization/nvp.hpp>
00025 #include <boost/serialization/is_bitwise_serializable.hpp>
00026 #include <boost/mpl/and.hpp>
00027 
00028 namespace boost { 
00029 namespace serialization {
00030 
00031 // pair
00032 template<class Archive, class F, class S>
00033 inline void serialize(
00034     Archive & ar,
00035     std::pair<F, S> & p,
00036     const unsigned int /* file_version */
00037 ){
00038     // note: we remove any const-ness on the first argument.  The reason is that 
00039     // for stl maps, the type saved is pair<const key, T).  We remove
00040     // the const-ness in order to be able to load it.
00041     typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME boost::remove_const<F>::type typef;
00042     ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("first", const_cast<typef &>(p.first));
00043     ar & boost::serialization::make_nvp("second", p.second);
00044 }
00045 
00047 template <class T, class U>
00048 struct is_bitwise_serializable<std::pair<T,U> >
00049  : public mpl::and_<is_bitwise_serializable<T>,is_bitwise_serializable<U> >
00050 {
00051 };
00052 
00053 } // serialization
00054 } // namespace boost
00055 
00056 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_UTILITY_HPP
